intro: Gilia micrantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white, which bloom in summer.
